comment: He is such a lovely professor and a joy to be in his class. His grading can be a little hard, but if you follow all the directions, you'll be fine. Also, there is so much supporting grades to the three major projects that even if you get Bs on all three major projects, if you get As on all supporting grades you will do great!
Definitely one of my favorite teacher. Plenty of chances to make up work and bring your grade up. Great person to talk to.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: AN AMAZING PROFESSOR!!! If you can take his courses, please do! You can really tell he cares about his students and loves what he does. He responds quickly to emails *even late at night* and has no problem giving you the most in detail answer on any question you have.

He really cares about his students, and his class is very enjoyable. We didn't have any tests throughout the semester, just four essays. But you get a lot of time to work on the essays, and the class isn't heavy on assignments. We were only assigned one discussion post a week, about the topics we learned during that week.

SO AMAZING TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN. He cares about his job and you can tell. The only work we did were short discussion posts every week on the lecture(which aren't boring)and 3 essays throughout the semester. He gave extensions on EVERY essay and gave extra credit in class. He is so amazing and will meet with you if needed. I recommend going to class.

TAKE HIM! He is so sweet and genuinely cares about you succeeding. Barley any work really. Every week you have a reading response basically asking for what affected you about the topic that week. Only 3 papers each worth 25%. Grades very fairly. TAKE HIM.

Dr. Gammil is very sweet and cares for all his students and wants them to do well. He grades not too hard but also not too east. If you need help he is the best help and will do his best to make sure you succeed in his class.

Dr. Gammill is a professor like no other, definitely the best one I will ever have. Never have I ever had a professor so passionate in his work and care for his students. I have learned more valuable skills from his class in all my academic career. He is truly an individual that makes class worth going to. He even gave donuts. Extremely recommend.

Dr. Gammill is my favorite professor I have had. He is very understanding of how busy college students are and will cut you slack if you're having trouble. He is a really nice guy and his class is really easy. Definitely take his class!

Dr. Gammill was very helpful and understanding to students. Like, extremely understanding. He posts extra resources to help, pushes back deadlines when needed. His lectures do feel a tiny bit long because he just talks and can go on tangents, but his classes are good. This is my second time taking him and do not regret it at all!

Literally the best professor you could ever take! He is super understanding if you miss an assignment deadline. Also he gives tons of extra credit opportunities and does his best to return your work for a second try to ensure you get the best grade possible. 10/10 WOULD recommend!

Dr. Gammill is AMAZING! He is the sweetest guy ever and gives off such dad vibes. You can tell he really cares about his students' success. He offers a ton of super easy extra credit, and he's not a terribly harsh grader! Every paper we turn in gets peer-reviewed first which helps a ton. I would 100% recommend taking his classes!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: he is very very good, theres not too much to do to do every week besides what you would expect from a college level english class. discussion post every week along with 3 major essays. showing up gets u extra credit a lot of times too.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I loved Dr. Gammil! Super relatable and easy to work with. Pay attention and put in the effort and he'll work with you. I wish I could have taken him for 1102.
Best professor at KSU hands done!!! Cares so much for his students and provided lots of extensions and extra credit when needed. Also gives the class donuts at the end of the semester!
Probably the best teacher I've had so far. He is flexible with his students and gives a lot of opportunity to do better. Overall amazing!

Dr. Gammill is a wonderful human being. He genuinely cares for his students and is very understanding when life things happen. You are given lots of time on the 3 papers so it's easy to make a good grade. I would highly recommend his class to anyone and everyone.

Great professor he really cares about all of his students and wants them all to succeed. Im honestly a lazy student and i finished the class with an A, so that should say something. Attendance is not mandatory, but if u show up he gives you a free 100 for missing or 0 discussion posts, and you have a lot of discussion posts.  Amazing teacher!

Great Lecturer, Very supportive on assignments, always available by email and responds quickly, puts more time into students than he should, he is very caring and wants you to be successful in his class.

This is the first English teacher I have had so far that takes the dullness out of English class. He is always genuine and cracks a few jokes here and there to lighten the mood. There was one weekly class that was not mandatory and one short weekly assignment. There were three essays and they all had credit recovery opportunities. Great teacher!

Attendance was taken but not mandatory, you old met once a week and there were only 3 papers throughout the semester. He was always available if you needed help and was willing to help you with whatever. I really liked this class it was easy and you had 1 discussion every week.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Pretty cool to be honest. He's really intellectual so prepare to come with an open mind and dictionary. He gives good lectures and for the love of God, make sure you watch and read the videos because for the weekly responses he will give you mediocre grades for only focusing on one portion of what we learned that week. But he's nice. It's hard.

Dr. G is one of the best professors I ever had. He is kind and funny and clearly cares so much about his job. He wants you to succeed and is willing to do whatever it takes for that to happen. He even changed the criteria of a paper for me to be able to write about what I wanted. If you are looking for an amazing class to take its 100% this one.

I took Dr Gammill over the summer online, but he was so kind and caring and can tell he cares about teaching. Absolute reccomend. He cares less about the nitty gritty of your papers and more about you learning how to become a more developed writer.

dr. gammill was by far my favorite professor this spring semester. there were 3 essays and i used to believe i wasn't good at writing and in all 3 essays i got all A's. i totally recommend him, the discussions are due every sunday and the takes time to grade them they wont always be 100's, he gives feedback and i would take his class again!

If you are looking for someone to take for English 1102, I would highly recommend Professor Gammill. His class follows a simple structure and it is relatively easy as long as you participate. You will have discussion posts due every Sunday. There are a few major papers spread out.. He is quick at responding to emails and cares about his students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Dr. Gammill is great! super easy work and he really cares about his students! Discussion posts almost every week due Sunday. A couple easy major assignments and last major assignment is final grade. I would take his class again if I could! Take him! easy A/B
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the best English teachers i had and was more than willing to help students if you need anything.

If you are looking for a professor that cares more about you learning over turning in assignments on time, he is the one for you. I grew a lot as a writer because he focused on the learning aspect over the grade.

Great professor, all of his instructions were clear and he basically walked through assignments with you. Was always willing to help and offer some feedback before final due dates. Also, very funny guy made the class very interesting and exciting.

Dr. Gammill is one of those profs that cares about the success of his students and loves what he's teaching. Very accessible outside of class. There were 1-2 discussion posts due every week and sometimes had some due in class as well. Heavy grader on the discussion posts but once you do a few you'll understand how he grades.

You can tell that Professor Gammill is very passionate about what he teaches. It's refreshing to see a good teacher at KSU. Professor Gammill cares about his students and very helpful and goes through assignments with details. and encourage to ask questions if you need help. Professor Gammill has a great personality and you'll have an easy semester

He can be very intimidating if you are not used to doing many writing assignments and tough grading. You will be expected to do 1-2 discussion posts each week which he grades harsher than the essays. But if you watch his lecture videos its the best way to go about discussion posts.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: He is really a great teacher. Weekly assignments and 1 research paper. Class is never too boring because he is very animated and you can tell he loves his job. Very detailed, easy to talk to, very respectful. 10/10 recommend.

Dr. Gammill is a good guy and you can tell he loves his job, however I wouldn't say his teaching skills are effective. I leave his classes confused, feeling like I learned nothing, and didn't know how to do the assignments. I never felt like I actually became a better writer or even knew what "rhetoric" was. He gives no criteria and grades harsh.

Hes a great teacher. Each and every class was always interesting to me. I always engaged in class and its not a hard class to pass. Just do your discussion posts every week and ask for help if needed. theres only a few major assignments i think 4 but other than that our grades come from discussions. great teacher and very nice guy

He is one of the most enjoyable teachers I have ever taken. In terms of difficultly, its a pretty easy A as long as you do the work required. Weekly assignments that do take some time but are worth it as they help you in writing your final assignments. He takes a while to grade papers so expect to wait a while. Other than that, you should take him

Be ready to work for your grade. He doesnt give the best feedback but you can always ask. Will do zoom or phone calls if you need help. Hes good for just a gened English class. Just do your work on time and you will do fine. Does not accept late work and sometimes will let you redo an assignment if you turned it in. Take him bc its easy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: this professor is super nice and is genuinely a really good person. however, he grades reallyy strictly for no reason and is kinda slow at giving back grades

I took him for 1101 and loved him so much, I took him for 1102. Not a huge workload, and has a very quick response time to emails. Sometimes, he gets a little behind with grading and posting assignments, but he was very helpful throughout the year and truly wants his students to succeed. I definitely recommend taking this professor!

He is an alright professor. There are 4 major assignments that are a huge chunk of your grade. He is not very clear with his instructions but gives great feedback on why you got the grade you got. I would take him if I was a great writer not if I struggle with writing essays.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Gammill is a great professor! There is 1 or 2 assignments a week and 4 big papers. Although there can be limited topic choice and a bit confusing, if you ask him he will more than happy to help. Drops two lowest assignments and averages 1 paper to a better grade. This class will be a breeze if you put in the time and effort. Solid Choice!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Get ready to write... A LOT. Heavy papers with few guidelines. If you are not a very good writer, do NOT take this class.

He is genuinely great and is very passionate about the subject while caring about his students! When there is a problem he responds quickly to emails and is happy to help, but you have to follow his criteria or you won't get a good grade.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Gammill is a professor that believes your schedule should revolve around his class. While the workload isn't awful, he is incredibly strict about adhering to his deadlines despite not being able to post content/grades on time. There was one time when class content was posted 4 days late and we waited over a month for for the first essay grade.

He's a very nice person, but there is an overwhelming amount of assignments to do every week. He expects you to turn everything in by his deadline with no exception, but cannot grade a small discussion post within the month. If you have time and effort to give into a single class, he's the professor for you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Seems scary to take someone that was new to KSU but a great choice. He gives excellent feedback to students and is willing to work with you to achieve your desired grade. He did give many quizzes that were mostly free response but he was an easy grader. He is really nice and his rubrics are straight forward as he gives leniency on writing choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria
